results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Project Democracy;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Texas
results.byline: By Azi Paybarah and David Montgomery
results.title: Texas Republicans Approve Far-Right Platform Declaring Biden’s Election Illegitimate
results.abstract: The platform, which was voted on at the Republican state party convention in Houston, was the latest sign of Texas conservatives moving further to the right.

media.caption: A resolution adopting the false claim that former President Donald J. Trump was the victim of a stolen election in 2020 was passed by Republican state-party delegates in Texas.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;Attorneys General;Special Prosecutors (Independent Counsel);Garland, Merrick B;Trump, Donald J;Biden, Joseph R Jr;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack;Justice Department;United States
results.title: Prosecute Trump? Put Yourself in Merrick Garland’s Shoes.
results.abstract: The attorney general will have to make three decisions, each more difficult than the previous, and none of which has an obvious answer.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Deaths (Fatalities);your-feed-healthcare
results.title: Despite Another Covid Surge, Deaths Stay Near Lows
results.abstract: Most Americans now carry some immune protection, experts said, whether from vaccines, infection or both.

media.caption: The United States remains better fortified against Covid deaths than it has ever been, scientists said.
media.copyright: Dave Sanders for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Golf;United States Open (Golf);Scheffler, Scottie (1996- );Fitzpatrick, Matthew (1994- );Zalatoris, Will (1996- );Matsuyama, Hideki;Country Club (Brookline, Mass)
results.title: At U.S. Open, Matt Fitzpatrick’s First PGA Tour Win Comes at a Major
results.abstract: Will Zalatoris and Scottie Scheffler, who tied for second, made it interesting down the stretch at the Country Club, but Fitzpatrick held on to finish at six under par.

media.caption: Matt Fitzpatrick of England celebrating with the U.S. Open Championship trophy after winning on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Political Advertising;Elections, Senate;Conservatism (US Politics);Midterm Elections (2022);Greitens, Eric;Missouri
results.title: In Ad, Shotgun-Toting Greitens Asks Voters to Go ‘RINO Hunting’
results.abstract: A right-wing Senate candidate accompanies a squad of heavily armed men as they storm a home looking for ‘Republicans in name only.’

media.caption: A still image from a political ad for Eric Greitens, a Republican candidate for Senate in Missouri.

results.adx_keywords: Quarantine (Life and Culture);Sleep;Content Type: Service;Melatonin (Hormone);Dreams;Insomnia;Psychology and Psychologists;Anxiety and Stress;Sedatives;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Jet Lag
results.title: Melatonin Isn’t a Sleeping Pill. Here’s How to Use It.
results.abstract: The “vampire hormone” can act like a dose of sunset, tricking your body into feeling like it’s time to sleep.

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;Sexual Harassment;Assaults;Movies;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Haggis, Paul;Italy
results.byline: By Emma Bubola and Sarah Bahr
results.title: Paul Haggis Arrested on Sexual Assault Charges in Italy
results.abstract: Haggis, who wrote and directed the Oscar-winning crime drama “Crash,” was accused of assaulting a woman in Ostuni over the course of two days.

media.caption: Paul Haggis, who was arrested on charges of aggravated sexual violence and aggravated personal injuries in Southern Italy. “He is totally innocent,” his lawyer Priya Chaudhry said.

results.adx_keywords: Bank Robberies;Consumer Protection;Frauds and Swindling;Banking and Financial Institutions;E-Commerce;Mobile Commerce and Payments;Robberies and Thefts;Chopra, Rohit;Bank of America Corporation;Capital One Financial Corporation;Consumer Financial Protection Bureau;JPMorgan Chase & Company;Senate Committee on Banking;Venmo;Wells Fargo & Company;Zelle (Early Warning Services LLC)
results.byline: By Stacy Cowley and Lananh Nguyen
results.title: When Customers Say Their Money Was Stolen on Zelle, Banks Often Refuse to Pay
results.abstract: Federal law requires banks to reimburse customers for unauthorized electronic transfers, but they often refuse, stranding victims.

media.copyright: Photo Illustration by Rafael Henrique/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Shopping and Retail;Labor and Jobs;Social Media;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Content Type: Personal Profile;audio-neutral-immersive;Dollar General Corp;TikTok (ByteDance)
results.title: How a Dollar General Employee Went Viral on TikTok
results.abstract: Mary Gundel loved managing a store in Tampa, Fla. But when she detailed its challenges on social media, the company — and fellow employees — took notice.

media.caption: Mary Gundel, who managed a Dollar General in Tampa, Fla., created the hashtag #PutInATicket because, she said, that was the company’s response to serious store issues.
media.copyright: Todd Anderson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Bicycles and Bicycling;Falls;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Rehoboth Beach (Del)
results.title: Biden Takes Tumble During Bike Ride in Delaware
results.abstract: The president did not need medical attention after he fell off his bike at a state park near his vacation home in Rehoboth Beach, according to the White House.

media.caption: President Biden after falling off his bike at Cape Henlopen State Park in Delaware. He and the first lady were spending the weekend at their vacation home in Rehoboth Beach.
media.copyright: Sarah Silbiger for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Fatalities);Movies;Television;Actors and Actresses;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Millar, Mark (1969- );Aguilar, Juan Francisco Gonzalez (d 2022);Cruz, Raymundo Garduno (d 2022);Netflix Inc;SAG-AFTRA;Baja California (Mexico)
results.title: Two Cast Members of ‘The Chosen One’ on Netflix Killed in Accident
results.abstract: The accident happened in transit to a local airport in Baja California Sur in Mexico. Six other cast and crew members were injured, Netflix confirmed.

media.caption: The Netflix show “The Chosen One” started shooting in Mexico in April.
media.copyright: Frederic J. Brown/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Elections;Petro, Gustavo;Hernandez, Rodolfo (1945- );Marquez, Francia;Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia;Colombia
results.title: Gustavo Petro Wins the Election, Becoming Colombia’s First Leftist Leader
results.abstract: The former rebel and longtime senator’s victory sets the third largest nation in Latin America on a sharply new path.

results.adx_keywords: Pregnancy and Childbirth;Abortion;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision)
results.title: With Roe Set to End, Many Women Worry About High-Risk Pregnancies
results.abstract: Most states likely to outlaw abortions allow for exceptions to save a mother’s life. But many women and doctors ask: Where will lawmakers draw the line?

media.caption: Tracee Miller, with her partner, is looking for a more definitive test of her amniotic fluid to determine whether to terminate her pregnancy, but she said she cannot get the test she needs until she is 16 weeks pregnant, a stage of development where abortion would be prohibited in many states.
media.copyright: Nancy Andrews for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Small Business;Computers and the Internet;E-Mail;Cloud Computing;Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Google Inc
results.title: Google Says It’s Time for Longtime Small-Business Users to Pay Up
results.abstract: Google is charging some small businesses for email and other apps after more than a decade of free use. Business owners say Google is being callous.

media.caption: Sam Xu reviewing the results of his SAT practice test with Mr. Dalton, who tutors him, at his company’s office in Vancouver.
media.copyright: Jennilee Marigomen for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Historic Buildings and Sites;Parks and Other Recreation Areas;Floods;National Parks, Monuments and Seashores;National Park Service;Yellowstone National Park;Montana;Wyoming;Idaho
results.title: Parts of Yellowstone Will Reopen This Week After Damaging Floods
results.abstract: The National Park Service also said it would spend $50 million on repairs that would restore access to about 80 percent of the park within two weeks.

media.caption: Receding floodwaters flowed past sections of a washed-out road in the northern section of Yellowstone National Park last week.

results.adx_keywords: War and Armed Conflicts;Civilian Casualties;Oromo (Ethnic Group);Tigrayans (Ethnic Group);Ahmed, Abiy;Oromo Liberation Army;Ethiopia;Oromia (Ethiopia)
results.title: Over 200 Feared Dead in Ethiopia Massacre
results.abstract: The killings were the latest to roil the Horn of Africa nation, which is reeling from a civil war that began almost two years ago.

media.caption: Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed of Ethiopia addressing the Parliament in Addis Ababa in June. Last week, Mr. Abiy announced the establishment of a committee to negotiate peace with the Tigrayans.

results.adx_keywords: Track and Field;Running;Content Type: Personal Profile;Elderly;Fort Lauderdale (Fla)
results.byline: By Talya Minsberg and Alexander Aguiar
results.title: These 90-Year-Old Runners Have Some Advice for You
results.abstract: Runners at the National Senior Games in Miramar, Fla., competed in events ranging from the 50 meters to 1,500 meters. Their secret? “You’ve got to keep moving.”

results.adx_keywords: Pregnancy and Childbirth;Abortion;Maternal Mortality
results.title: Sure, Just Have the Baby
results.abstract: There are good reasons American women overwhelmingly choose having an abortion over giving up a child for adoption.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack;Arizona;Georgia
results.title: Jan. 6 Hearing Will Highlight Trump’s Pressure Campaign on State Officials
results.abstract: The House committee investigating the Capitol attack will also underscore the vitriol and suffering that election workers endured because of President Donald J. Trump’s lies.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: President Donald J. Trump pushed Brad Raffensperger, Georgia’s secretary of state, to “find” him enough votes to put the state in his column. Mr. Raffensperger will testify before the Jan. 6 committee on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Audra Melton for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Illiteracy;Dyslexia;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Content Type: Personal Profile;Calkins, Lucy;Teachers College of Columbia University
results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times
